Appearance
From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From desperdicio +‎ -ar, from Late Latin disperditiāre (“losing”), from Latin disperdō (“to lose completely”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /despeɾdiˈθjaɾ/ [d̪es.peɾ.ð̞iˈθjaɾ] (Spain)
  • IPA(key): /despeɾdiˈsjaɾ/ [d̪es.peɾ.ð̞iˈsjaɾ] (Latin America, Philippines)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: des‧per‧di‧ciar

Verb

[edit]

desperdiciar (first-person singular present desperdicio, first-person singular preterite desperdicié, past participle desperdiciado)

  1. (transitive) to waste
    Synonyms: farrear, derrochar, despilfarrar, malbaratar, malgastar

[edit]
